fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e1.equipments.heater

Interface HeaterUserCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, HeaterExternalControlI, HeaterTemperatureI, HeaterUserI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    HeaterUserJava4CI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HeaterUserConnector, HeaterUserInboundPort, HeaterUserJava4InboundPort, HeaterUserOutboundPort

    public interface HeaterUserCI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI, HeaterUserI
    The component interface HeaterUserCI declares the signature of the services offered and that can be required by the user from the heater.

    Description

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

      • setCurrentPowerLevel

        void setCurrentPowerLevel(fr.sorbonne_u.alasca.physical_data.Measure<java.lang.Double> powerLevel)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: HeaterExternalControlI
        set the power level of the heater; if powerLevel.getData() > getMaxPowerLevel().getData() then set the power level to the maximum.

        Contract

         pre     on()
 pre     powerLevel != null && powerLevel.getData() >= 0.0 && powerLevel.getMeasurementUnit().equals(POWER_UNIT)
 post    powerLevel.getData() > getMaxPowerLevel().getData() || getCurrentPowerLevel().getData() == powerLevel.getData()
 post    powerLevel.getData() <= getMaxPowerLevel().getData() || getCurrentPowerLevel().getData() == Heater.MAX_POWER_LEVEL.getData()
        Specified by:
        setCurrentPowerLevel in interface HeaterExternalControlI
        Parameters:
        powerLevel - the powerLevel to be set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        HeaterExternalControlI.setCurrentPowerLevel(fr.sorbonne_u.alasca.physical_data.Measure)
